intro: Sorbus aucuparia subsp. euaucuparia, commonly known as the European rowan, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its clusters of small, bright red berries that are a food source for birds and other wildlife. The plant typically grows to a height of 3–8 meters and has compound leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are inconspicuous, greenish-yellow, and appear in clusters, while the bark is smooth and grayish in color. This subspecies is adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both sunny and partially shaded environments.
